description: Just found this place out.  Lovely hiking area.  Not sure if dogs are allowed off leashed, but took some there today off leash and no one complained.  Beautiful scenery and trail.  Will need to revisit this hiking area.
author: A T.

description:
I challenge you to find a more breath-taking spot on this planet. The cliffs, the ocean, "the bridge", and a little slice of nature all tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

If you like to jog or walk your dog, then there is no where better on a sunny day. Make sure you wear something warm as the ocean breeze can be quite frigid. 

Don't forget to check out the Sutro baths on the west end of the trail or walk up to the Palace of Legion of Honor on the east end. If you have time on your journey, make sure to grab a drink at the Cliff House.
author: Dave L.

description: One of the best views of the ocean and GG Bridge in the city.  It takes a while to get out here, but once you do, it's just gorgeous.  The trail is pretty easy for kids and dogs (although there are some steps so it may be difficult for strollers).
author: B. Y.

description:
Ah sweet, sweet nature.

Lands End is great for me and my pup to escape the madness of the city, and it is only a few short blocks away from where I live.  Amazing views of the Golden Gate and the Pacific stretching away.  The Marin Headlands across the water aren't so shabby either.

However, heed this warning from a mildly idiotic man (in my moments anyway) - DO NOT ATTEMPT TO BIKE THIS TRAIL.  

Headphones on, bumping good breakbeats, and I decide to go for a ride.  One those rides where the music makes you want to turn your bike into something out of F-Zero.  Flying around my first tour of Lands End, all was good and dandy and speedy until I hit a somewhat sharp (and mostly blind) corner, slid around in the dirt (it wasn't exactly a mountain bike) and nearly did my first, greatest, and only cliff dive.  Actually, just remove the 'v' and call it for what it would have been - a cliff die.  

Now, I tend to simply walk it.  While riding the bike didn't kill me, carrying it up the countless stairs nearly did.
author: Quinn Z.

description:
I came here for my first DKY event. It's a great, quick way to get some exercise, some fresh air and take in some spectacular views.

The trail was 3 miles round trip. It was relatively easy, but can be made more challenging with all of the different trail options. If you feel the need there are lots of stairs you can do, or not. Also, a great place to bring the pooch to play. The beginning of the trail is rather narrow so if it is busy and your dog is crazy like mine you may want to keep them on leash for awhile. 

Parking is easy. The best way to find the beginning of the trail os 32nd Ave & El Camino Del Mar.

Remember to bring water :)
author: Aubrey W.

description:
This park is great for a number of reasons.  If you're an avid runner, start out on the trail, pass Sutro Baths, the Cliff House, and Ocean Beach, then go left through Golden Gate Park, left again at the Pan Handle, curve around at Sunset, and end up back in Seacliff.  It seems like a lot but the breathtaking views (especially when you're running along the ocean) make up for it.  

This would also be a great place to take a date, there are numerous little side trails that lead to random bluffs, private enough for two to have a picnic, or whatever.

Personally, I like to explore alone, one time,  I was wandering down one of the trails and ended up right next to the ocean and what looked like a portion of someones kitchen or bathroom that had fallen into it.  You could see the remnants of old tiled walls and some sort of flooring, and for some reason, I thought this was interesting.
author: Katie F.

description:
Land's End is wonderful!  The park that covers the northwestern corner of San Francisco offers some of the most gorgeous views and nicest walking paths available in the city.  Starting from 48th and Ocean, you can walk all the way to the gorgeous Sea Cliff neighborhood, hugging the coast all of the way.  Amazing views of the Marin coastline and Golden Gate Bridge abound, as well as the craggy cliffs and vast shoreline of the San Francisco peninsula.

The parking lot and monument at Land's End Point (at the northern terminus of 48th Ave) offers a great, and easily accessible, view of the bay and the Golden Gate.  An added benefit is that, on a clear evening, the hills and the park block a lot of the nearby light pollution, offering some quality star gazing (well, for a city at least).  The illuminated Golden Gate Bridge also makes the night trek worthwhile.
author: Eric M.

description:
When I first started seeing construction being done to this place, I was upset that they were messing with my daily jogging route.  I mean trees were being uprooted, cliff sides were dug up, and fences installed where there used to be free space.  

Gradually though, my opinion started to change as wondrous vistas to the Golden Gate started opening up, and the trails proved to be gorgeously awe inspiring.  Feelings of timelessness, of stillness.  Of being so small.  These are the things I get from Lands End.

Take a morning jog or a light stroll along one of the trails for some fresh air and fantastic views.  You'll feel great for the whole week.  A job well done to the Parks Conservancy.  Thank you.
author: Philip W.

description:
LADIES READ THIS: I just ran across Katie A.'s review featured on the homepage and remembered my jog last month through Land's End park:

Just as I was approaching Sutro Baths jogging south on the trail with my cousin, we heard a bird chirp on the bluff to the left. I looked up and realized it was actually a guy perched up on a cliff in the trees trying to get our attention. I looked up for a split second and he was FLASHING us!  All I saw was  a blur of flesh, tattoos, and a joker-esque smile out there--and he was lovin' every minute of it. I saw less than my cousin did, partially because my baseball cap obscured my view. For the next mile of our jog, all I heard about was how violated my cousin felt about our Tommy Lee exhibitionist. By the end of the jog, my cousin decided she thought he was kinda cute and wanted to go back and introduce herself. I told her to knock herself out. Of course she was joking, but, there is always some truth to a joke.

Anyhow, now I don't feel as safe jogging through there (esp. alone) and I'm keeping me headphone volume down! FYI!

4 stars for the scenery and dirt path= easy on the joints. 1 one point deduction for the obvious.
author: Katie M.

description:
Simply breathtaking views of the ocean and GG bridge - I'm surprised I never even knew this place existed until now!!
The hike down to Eagle Point was blocked off yesterday unfortunately, but I will definitely be heading back there soon.

Boys...this is a GREAT place to take your ladies if you want to have a laid-back time.  I imagine it's a pretty romantic place to be right around sunset time.
author: Stephanie W.

description: The trail is a little over a mile in each direction and the views are absolutely amazing!! This morning the fog was pretty thick but still a great walk. We usually park in the lot near the Cliff House and then walk to brunch at one of the local restos afterwards. It's a great leisurely stroll if you have friends/family in town.
author: Adriana G.

description:
You'll feel as if you stepped into Lord of the Rings if you happen to lose yourself on a windy trail on the mountainside.  Perhaps you'll stumble upon the old stone remains of buildings covered in vines and flowers. If you stay on the beaten path, you'll see a beautiful view of the Golden Gate  Bridge, and follow the jagged edge of the Sea Cliff around.

I used to  spend 2 hours trail running up and down the mountain trails, getting lost a few times and popping out in the strangest places.  I'd watch from afar as the huge ships went by, and try to race them.  I took my Dad here when he came to visit and he still talks about it to this day as a place that took his breath away.  Highly recommended for everything: a stroll, a light run on the beaten path, a rigorous trail run from the beach to the top, or just a place to sit on a bench (on a cliff overlooking the sea) and think...
author: crystala t.

description:
are you kidding me?! this place is WAY over-hyped! it's always freezing, windy, and  foggy and those blasted fog horns sound like a tuba playing in the bathtub.

even worse, people have fallen to their deaths here  - yes, to their DEATHS - and there are signs posted all around to remind you. those cliffs are truly dangerous.

beware and tread this path with much caution! in fact, just stay away altogether for your own safety...
author: Art O.

description: I loved this place.  I have never been before nor did I even know it existed.  There are gorgeous views.  The memorial to the USS San Francisco was inspiring.  Next time I hope to have more time to explore the area more.
author: Brandy H.

description:
I agree wholeheartedly with everbody: the beauty, quality, and serenity of this place is unmatched.  

Best time of the day to go:  Sunny, weekday mornings.  Best time to take pictures and there's nobody around to bother you.  

What to be aware of:  Be careful of the tides.  I heard that a few people in the past have been swept away, so avoid this place during high tides.

What I didn't know about this place for the longest time: The history behind Sutro Baths.  There used to be a swimming pool until it was burned down waaayyy back in the day.  There also used to be a train that would roll past the park.
author: Joe V.

description:
Really beautiful hiking trail from the Sutro bath all the way to the China beach.  Phenomenon views of the Golden Gate bridge and just incredible views of the ocean.
Only problem is... where the heck is the secluded beach?!?!  We've hiked the trail 2 times, wandered down every path possible, but no beach?
author: Steffy W.

description:
On a really nice day, you can see the Golden Gate Bridge, and good ocean views. If the tide is low enough, you can see old wreckage of steam ships that hit its rocks during the gold rush era. But, you got to know where they are. hehehe 

It's good for trail running, hiking, cross training if you're into climbing stairs. The nice part about this trail is that it runs right in Robin Williams neighborhood (Seacliff) and down to China Basin. A nice secluded beach where you can play with your puppy.

It's also a nice place for photos of the bridge.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
One of my favorite places in the city! 
What a treat to have such gorgeous ocean and bridge views.
author: Chili B.

description: Great hike. the views of golden gate and the bay are truly incredible. It has both challenging hills for those that are into that, and easy, level walks for those that aren't. It's just enough removed from SF to be relaxed, and close enough to be doable.
author: Morgan W.

description:
I recommend straying off the main trails to explore the little semi-open paths off to the side. There is a whole different world out there. For example, one of them leads to "the maze". 

And, not for the faint of heart, go at night, under the moon light, take a flash light, and with two or more people if possible. It's become like a sport for some people. :)) Just be careful, in some areas, one misstep and you could fall off the cliff!
author: Float C.

description: the steps to the top makes me hum the rocky theme and once on top the views from left to right gives me the urge to sing the pointer sisters or otis redding
author: Clark G.

description:
I met a friend here for a walk.  The view is spectacular.  When I went, there were not too many people (but i guess it was a Thursday morning), so we got to enjoy the amazing park almost by ourselves.

Plenty of free parking or easy bus access.  

Make sure you stop by on any trip to SF.
author: Jolene W.

description:
Leave the dirty city streets behind for a breathtaking walk through the shadowy cypress and rocky seaside cliffs of Lands End Park. Situated between the famous Cliff House and majestic Legion of Honor, the parks' captivating ocean views will force you to leave your heart in San Francisco. 

Guys..... If you really want to "sweep her off her feet", try a trip to Lands End Park. These romantic windy cliffs are guaranteed to take her breath away!
author: Caroline J.

description: great place to go and hike or ride ur bike it has beautful scenery and lovely restraunts nearby! I love spending  my saturday here!
author: Sophia C.

description: Best trail in sf, the views mind boggling and tons of cool spots to relax along the way
author: Chris H.

description:
This place is eerily breathtaking. We discovered it while driving along the coast. I guess the entire "Land's End Park" spans a pretty large area, but we took a few winding paths and steep steps and randomly found ourselves by the water and surrounded by cliffs. It's so secluded and visually mesmerizing.

Yet another favorite spot I've discovered that once again reminds me how much I want to move to San Francisco!!

(*100th* review!! my, how much I blabber. I mean Yelp.)
author: Jeni Y.

description:
Simple one of the most astounding views and parks in the country!!!  Just take your time meandering about, getting lost... both driving and walking.

Take your time.... bring a picnic, and walk around.

Someone else said it best... it is "raw and beautiful"
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: Beautiful place. Makes the high price tag of SF worth it to have this place in the back yard. Fantastic views. Pretty cool people that frequent this place. Try the coastal hike, it's like a scene out of Lost. And beware of the golf carts, they come almost seem like they come out of nowhere.
author: Linda H.

description:
Screw the gym.
I hike this trail up and back a couple of times a week
and it's never seemed like the same trip twice.

Stunning vistas and sea-birds vs. infomercials and preening twats.
Fresh ocean air vs. stale sweat.

And you pay how much?
author: Don Q.

description: You almost want to keep it a secret--once you find this place. That's how magical it is! I like the winding path that lead you to the steps; and the grand views of the Golden Gate Bridge... then at the end of the trail is this amazing rock maze that will make you feel like you've found the treasure!
author: Clarice A.

description: Beautiful view, nice place to hike, but to me the highlight is the USS San Francisco Memorial. One of the most decorated ships of WWII.
author: Nick R.

description:
Great 1.5 mile hike right here in San Francisco! 

The trees, the cliffs, the golden gate bridge views, the ocean...

If you haven't been here yet, and you live in The City......Do It Now.
author: Mike S.

description:
I don't know what hole I've been living in, but I couldn't believe I hadn't been here yet after living in the bay area for so long.  Luckily my friends hadn't either so I'm not the only one.  Maybe we're hobbits.  Or just out of it.  

Anyway, FANTASTIC views along the coast (as everyone else is raving as well).  I regret forgetting a camera, but it's so close by and easy to go back anyway.  

Bring money if you are hungry and want to eat at the Cliff House by the Sutro baths.  If only more hikes had food establishments along the trail.
author: Chris P.

description:
I'm not a view snob, so for me it's hard to find a bad view in the city.  But Lands End is pretty special.

Short of a boat or helicopter, this is the most unusual vantage point for the GG bridge.  You stand there, look back at the bridge and the city, turn and look out over the Pacific and feel like an amazing singular being at the same time that you feel part of a consciousness beyond your little self.  Really.  And that's substance free.

On a more prosaic note--take a bottle of water with you, you won't want to hurry back to the corner store of civilization too soon!
author: Cynthia B.

description: Came here with Autumn R. last week in my mission to explore San Francisco. We walked along the entire coastal trial and were taken aback a few times by the beautiful views of the ocean and GG bridge. It was breathtaking. The hike is more like a walk with some steep steps, but they aren't too bad. Once you get to the end of the trial, you are let out into a beautiful neighborhood with multi million dollar homes. Autumn R. and I enjoyed walking around and imagining ourselves living here. There really is no city more beautiful than SF (I think)...Land's End is a great way to enjoy some beautiful scenery right in the city!
author: Amanda E.

description:
You know its legit when there's a sign warning you not to trod 50 ft to your left because people have died... ahhh.... the cliffs!  It's really nice to come here with a friend or your lover or your mom or anyone, including just yourself, for a nice hour hike/walk.  

I personally like to prep by strolling around Sutro Park first, then walking across the street and going down to the ruins of the Sutro Baths, then hiking up the cliffs and finding my way onto the trail.  Then you can walk that scenic, paved trail with some ups and downs for a good distance, with choices to veer off toward the Legion of Honor or continue to that Eagle's Point.  Or you can be really daring and walk more on the cliffs near the ocean past the Sutro Bath ruins.  But people have died.
author: Ashley S.

description: We literally come here every weekend for a quick walk. We found this place earlier in 2009. I dont even know when it was opened. The view here is amazing and makes it so easy to go on an easy hike. There are certain stop area to take pictures. The golden gate is visible on a clear sky. Listen to the waves crash onto shore. People go running here. Bring your dog and kids to fully enjoy it. The trails are really easy that a caveman can do it. Actually, we saw seniors in their 90s walking the trails with their canes. Everytime we come here, we always see something amazing. It's the little things that counts. Enjoy
author: Ernie P.

description: This is that park over near Seacliff/Sutro Heights and faces the Golden Gate bridge sort of near the Sutro baths. Its the perfect place to go with someone you love (or really like) because its so gorgeous. A nice hiking trail, beautiful views of the ocean and the GG Bridge. You can even take the trail down to the secluded beach and.... well, you get the idea :)
author: Michelle I.

description: After doing the trail stairs you can continue upwards to the park. Another spectacular view of the Golden Gate Bridge and waves from a distance. As you are drying up from the sweat consumed from the exercise of the trails, it's also a very romantic spot to sit and enjoy. You get to enjoy the serenity and tranquil feeling of what nature has to offer. We even saw a seal popping its head for a few seconds! What a treat to live in San Francisco, everything is so close by, yet so beautiful and heavenly.
author: T L.

description:
back before i discovered a little cliff top clearing in the marin headlands, lands end was my "special secret spot" where i would go to clear my head, take in the spectacular views, and just breathe fresh ocean air.

this awesome park on the outskirts of the city provides some of the best walking trails around.  and the beaches are just totally empty--no one around...it's incredible!!  once as we were walking around, we discovered this weird place with all these pebbles collected around in a labyrinth.  the ex found it a little blair witch, but i thought it wonderfully relaxing and meditative.  i've never been able to find it again though :(.
author: Roshni R.

description:
Lands End Park.  Or, as I like to call it, the Blair Witch Project experience.

You may be "in the know" or you may be thinking "WTF?"

If you are in the WTF category I'll give you the goods....

On the ocean side of the walking trail you will see a few little trails heading into the underbrush.

Say bye to gram and gramps on the boring-ass main trail and pick one of these offshoots.

You will head into some thick underbrush and discover one or more of the following:

- homeless encampment - but usually abandoned during the day - if you go down here at night you are truly batshit!

- natural shelters created by the thick vines and brush - sometimes you are literally walking thru a cave of branches - creepy fer sure


- rocks, sticks, or other debris arranged much in the same fashion as, OMG THE BLAIR WITCH!  FAWWWWWWWWWWWWK!  Let's get out of here!!

Yah.  For realz!

In any event, much more exciting than the main trail, IMO.  

There are some steep sections so make sure you are wearing decent shoes.  And it can get muddy, so, be prepared to destroy aforementioned decent shoes.  

There are a couple parts, when you are close to the beach, that may be life-threatening.  For example, unstable earthen cliffs and steep muddy slopes that will lead to certain pain and possible death should you fall down onto the rocks below.
author: David M.

description: Great views - almost as good as Marin Headlands, and easier to get to.  A few minutes of hiking and you can forget that you are in the city.  Also a great place to take visitors that want to see Big Sur and don't have the time.  I just tell 'em "it looks pretty much like this... now let's go eat!"
author: Jeremy S.

description: One of the best places to go in the city to find great views of the wide expanse of the Pacific, windswept cliffs, and even a bit of wildlife.  Good for your "you" time.
author: Jack H.

description: This is one view in SF that you just can't miss. To me it's way better than fisherman's wharf.
author: Shirley W.

description: This place is really a hidden gem on the edge of the city. When I feel crowded or too enclosed and sick of the urban atmosphere I just make a short trip here and it's like you're in a new world experiencing nature on a personal level. The coastal trails connects from the Sutro Baths near the Cliff House all the way close to China Beach. Once you're there that's where the Golden Gate Bridge sightings can be seen if you go a little further east towards Baker Beach after the edge of Lincoln Park in the Richmond/Sea Cliff neighborhood. You can go jogging, sightseeing, or strolling and get away definitely. Stress reliever without a doubt!
author: Brandon H.

description: The best urban hiking anywhere. Eat some boomers and head down the stairs to the beach next to the spiral labyrinth--it's the best beach in the city. MUST visit stop for out of towners. Look out for dolphins and aggro joggers.
author: Geronimo G.

description: this place is literally one of my favorite spots on the planet earth. its such a fantastic way to step out of the city for even just 15 minutes. the sound of the waves, the ocean breeze, the amazing views. this place has it all. i still have yet to bring an out-of-town friend here and them not say that it wasnt one of the highlights of the trip. simply put, its not one of those places that makes San Francisco so unique and wonderful. I try to make it out there at least once every 2-3 months.
author: Andrew D.

description: I love that the views are spectacular.  I love that the trails end up at the ruins of a 19th century bath house. I love that it is dog-friendly (I don't have a dog, but I am a dog-lover) and I love that Lands End feels like you've escaped from it all, but its zip code is still squarely in San Francisco.  Wish I could have my wedding there.
author: Gloria A.

description: I love Land's End. I have been here twice so far, and I haven't gone th the same areas more than once. It's amazing. I love it. I love being outdoors, and this is my favorite place in the whole city. It's close to my house, and I don't get tired while I am walking about. Plus, beautiful views! There's such a neat history and it's great that they post signs about the old rail tracks and shipwrecks. This is the most peaceful place in the city, in my opinion. Best of all, it's free!
author: Tiffany P.

description: Gorgeous scenery and nice paths. I felt like I had left the city to go into some sort of dream world.
author: Helene K.

description: My boyfriend made out with his coworker here last weekend.  I don't blame it on the park, but it doesn't really make me love it, either.  I guess if you're looking to entice someone, this is the place.  Yippee.
author: Ljótur H.

description: I took my girlfriend here last week for a cute date. It was really nice to just look out in the ocean and have that wonderful view of the Golden Gate bridge. Me and my girlfriend sat on the edge of the cliff right where that voodoo circle thing is and had PBJ sandwiches. Yeah, what can I say, I'm a hopeless romantic. Just a word of advice, don't try to take a picture of the view w/ your phone when your standing on the edge of the cliff, because you will drop it and it will either fall in the grass bellow or the water. Trust me.
author: Gabby H.

description:
one of the great things about being a newbie in san francisco is you find places like this. this is because we newbies read TODO and tourist style magazines that no local would be caught dead reading. a lot of locals may have heard of it but will not go as they might look like a tourist. i've heard it from time to time how we find or go to places a local has never heard of or just doesn't go for one reason or another. all because we read those mags.

when my wife and i went part of the trail was closed. they appear to putting down a new trail. but what we did see enough to know this is a gem of a walk. the views are great and many. it is an easy walk to spend with someone special. i look forward to walk it again to see what we missed.
author: roger b.

description: It was a great hike with a great view. It was a pretty clear day with a view of the golden gate bridge. The labyrinth was cool but it seemed to be more of a meditation labyrinth than a find your way out one. A lot of left behinds in the middle which were cool and the beach down below the trail had a good view.
author: Derek N.

description: I can't believe I had never been here until today.  You really feel like you are on the edge of the world when you are standing on some of these cliffs.  The view of the bridge and the water is incredible.  I wouldn't recommend wearing sandals or riding a bike or bringing a stroller here.  There are alot of stairs and the trail is very narrow in parts, thus not stroller friendly but people did it anyway...arghhh.  The trail is very woodsy in some parts, it reminds me of the trails I used to run in cross country in high school, really secluded and peaceful.  It wasn't very busy today but I can imagine it might be more crowded on a weekend.  I plan on coming back often.
author: Rosie F.

description:
probably hands down, my favorite place in san francisco.

great for views, running, hiking, dogs, tourists, photo hunting, dates, 

bad for.... swimming. HAAAAAA

short walk to sutro baths too. 

this place DEFINES the california coast
author: Irene C.

description: This is by far my favorite place in all of San Francisco. The best thing to do on a sunny yet cool day is to walk the trail from the Sutro Baths end to the Seacliffe end. The trail is dotted with benches for sitting and gazing across the bay. About half way into the trail there is a path down to a sheltered beach where on a weekday if you are lucky you might have all to yourself. Granted this is NOT a swimming beach, but a making out, getting high and watching the waves beach. You can easily forget you are in a city. It is a little bit of Big Sur, right here in our faire city.
author: Nina B.

description:
Used to be my favorite park in the city.  Eh... I guess it still is.  But that "Trails Forever" crap is ruining it.  Seriously.  Why aren't people more upset about it?  They've already paved the main path and torn down tons of trees, and yes, they plan on doing more... I got pamphlets from them showing their plans - concession stands, completely paved areas, more forest torn down, etc...  All of this is under the guise of "habitat restoration", but I honestly don't know what animal's natural habitat is concession stands and concrete.  And the animals living there have adapted to it - so they'll be killing off the wildlife as they develop it.  What happened to the raccoons and cats?  I haven't seen any foxes since they started, either.  So yeah, they're ruining it - but hey, easier access for tour buses and pastel clad tourists.  So to hell with the park - it can be destroyed so ugly tourists can visit it once in their life without getting mud on their shoes. *rolls eyes*  Everyone go to http://www.parksconservancy.org/ and send them a bitchy E-mail... please?

In other news... I love this park.  Foxes (er... see above)!!!  So cute!  And at low tide, there's this fab tidepool with starfish and little crabs and whatnot.  My dog LOVES the tidepool.  LOVES IT!  He barks at starfish (they can't hear, can they?  I hope not... poor things.  I'll wikipedia it) Oh, and that cliff/plateau thing... with the circle/maze, where people leave stuff in the center?  It's so pretty.  Absolutely magical.  If you're not afraid of the dark (yeah, a lot of adults are - you can admit it) it's a great place to go at night.  Oh, and what happened to that guy who used to stand on the cliffs and sing old sailor and gospel songs?    I liked him.  There's also a rope swing in that little isolated area to the northeast of that plateau (where it dips down to that other little beach where sealions sun-bathe - on the top of the hill at the other side).  It's really rad.  And OMG!!!  You know that blocked off area where people have died?  There's a rope thing blocking it... ignore that.  There's a nice little ledge (just don't teeter at the side of the cliff and you'll be fine).  And that little forested hill immediately to the left of where the blocked area starts... if you decide you want pot there's usually someone smoking there.  Oh... and tons of anise to pick and chew while you hike (just avoid everything at pee-range).  Also, at the end (from Sutro, headed towards Legion of Honor, go up the stairs, then down the first set of stairs on the other side.  Turn right.  Immediately below the golf course there's a blackberry oasis (good to know if you're hiking in August/September).  Nomn nomn!!!

I really hope the "Trails Forever" crap doesn't ruin it. =(  Would get 5 stars if not for that.
author: Tel Avivsion M.

description: Eagle Point, a small-to-midsize climb-down deck off Land's End trail, is the place for decisions.  On an uncompromising cliff overlooking the Golden Gate, its harsh winds, fog, sadness and sand, will bleach you an ancient grey.  Everything fixes here so your choice will be romantic, the results beautiful and eternal.  Admission is free; exit impossible.
author: Gil S.

description: Based on Yelpers' recommendations that this was an amazing place, and perfect for a date, my boyfriend and I went here the other day. It made for a wonderful day, panoramic and romantic. It's the kind of place that really exhilarates you and just fills you with that "Isn't it great to be alive?" kind of feeling....I can't wait to go back and explore some more!
author: Barbs J.

description: A place I like to take the DaWg for a good quick run.  Unfortunately lately, due to the reconstruction, it has become over populated with pedestrians, which rather takes the fun out of the run because I am constantly dodging those who refuse to step aside on the narrower parts of the trail.  Ruff, Growl.
author: Cris B.

description: BEAUTIFUL!  I can't believe I've lived here all my life, passed this place a million times and have never been here until now.  It's truly amazing.  I reccommend parking by the Cliff House and using their restroom at the start of the hike. ( I don't consider port-o-potties real restrooms haha!)  The sights (golden gate bridge, cliff house, palace of legion of honor, sutro baths) are magnificent.  I don't reccommend this hike/walk if you're not accustomed to climbing stairs.  Throughout our hike we must have climbed 600+ stairs.  I stopped counting after 500!  This place is a heaven for dogs.  I can't wait to come back.
author: Shana Y.

description: Ok, I'm a little biased about this place because i live around the corner but it is unreal. At times you don't even realize that your in a major city. They recently re-grated the trails and paved part of it making it a little more accesable to all. For bikers (MTB only) this is actually a little shortcut from the ORD to the bridge. I can generally cut 5 minutes off my time taking the Lands end trail (although you didn't hear that from me because i think theres no bikes on part of the single track). Anyhoo, enjoy it, take nothing but pictures yada yada.
author: Lindonesia S.

description: If you live in San Francisco but have never been to Lands End, you're missing out SO MUCH.  I love nature, and i love to go on trails just to cleanse my mind.  Lands End is SF's best hidden treasure for me.  There're many secret paths that will take you to unexpected places.  Bring a bottle of water and a camera, and get ready to hike.  The view of the sea, golden gate bridge, and the trees and shrub will take your breath away.  I like to park the car at the huge parking lot next to Cliff House and enter the trail from there.  Not recommended for older folks.  Go with family, significant other, or just by yourself.  You will not regret.  There's a labyrinth.  I've never seen anything like that before.  Google: "labyrinth lands end san francisco"
author: Jessica N.

description: My husband has brought me here for several lovely dates. This is definitely one of the best places in the city to enjoy nature and feel like you're kind of in the great outdoors. The mini-hikes are a great way to spend part of an afternoon, and the views are awesome.
author: Ramon E.

description: The absolute best hiking trail in all of SF. You will be surrounded by trees and hike along the coast from Sutro Hts to Sea Cliff. The views are amazing. There is a little viewing area by some rocks where you can watch some very daring surfers take on the waves. It gives me chills to see this. I have done this hike maybe 50 times since living close by and each time it takes my breathe away. Be sure to visit Sutro Heights Park if you come out on the Sunset/Richmond side. And, go to Park Chalet (not Beach Chalet) for a drink after.
author: Amy E.

description: Hike during the day- see some amazing views. Hike at night, bring a flashlight and a good imagination.
author: Judy L.

description: Start at the Sutro Bath's after lunch at the cliff house and end in seacliff.  You'll feel like you are in a movie.  All you need is your own personal soundtrack.
author: Lauren S.

description:
the views are stunning and the park is beautiful.  a must do for any local or visitor, espcially on a nice day during sunet.

one warning: a lot of people seem to like parking along the 17th hole of the lincoln park gc... it's probably not the smartest idea since a mis-hit golf ball can easily hit your car.
author: Daniel L.

description: Land's End is so beautiful. The view from the cliffs makes it a very romantic spot.  Very nice daytime date place.
author: Dana C.

description: I almost don't want to give this a favorable review because I don't want it to get super crowded...but I really feel it my civic duty to tell you how great this hike is.  Amazing views, perfect amount of exercise, good length...I take every out of town friend here to show off just how great SF gets.
author: Allison D.

description: This is a great park that is little used.  It is next to the Legion of Honor and a golf course.  Walk through the golf course and wind your way down to the excellent walking trails that twist and turn along the cliffs.  You can see the ocean, the bay, and the Golden Gate Bridge.  I have brought friends and lovers there alike, and everyone always feels this is a romantic place.  Bring a bottle of wine, some cheese, and a blanket and you can set up camp at the rocky little beach where few people travel.  Definitely a place to go with loved ones.
author: Jason W.

description: My favorite running trail/unwind spot in SF! Gorgeous views (go all the way out to Eagle's Point and you'll have a great view of the ocean and cliffs), good place to run/hike alone since there are always a few people around. But the best part is the views and the sound of waves... enjoyable and inspiring!
author: What's in a nam e.

description:
This place is awesome.  You can just sit in your car and not worry about a thing. The view is fantastic since you can see the other side of the GG bridge.  This is a place that not many people know of.  Most of the times people just stay farther down in ocean beach, but if you take the time to drive up the huge hill you will notice two locations that have endearing views of the ocean, and the beach as well.  It does get kind of chilly up here, but that should be no problem as long as you go with a special someone.
There is a trail that will get you to the beach, the walk is a very pleasant one, there is not a lot of people that go there.  At times you will encounter joggers, dog walkers, and bikers, but other than that not a lot of people are there.   along the trail you will actually come by benches that face the water, what could be better, up on top of a cliff sitting on a bench overlooking the water.
At night it does get very very dark, there is no adequate lighting, so i recommend not going into the trail.  The only lighting offered there is the moon, when it is shining bright, and the police lights that hover around the area looking for suspicious activities.
in other words, If you need a good place to hang out in the afternoons this is one of the few places in san francisco, that is not over populated.
author: Christopher L.

description: Never fails to impress the out of town guest, and of course a great little hiking trip on a weekend to remind us of what  a special place San Fran is. Amazing views, and feels a million miles away from the city.  Great, easy afternoon getaway.
author: Mark N.

description: Lands End Park is one of those places that reminds me why I love living in the bay area. I love that you can be in an urban city, but with a brief trek, be in this park for some of the best ocean views around. My walking group always likes to take our long training walks through here, rewarding those long hours on our feet with some amazing scenery.  Wait awhile after rain to visit, as it can get pretty muddy on the trails.
author: Megan K.

description: Beautiful place to take friends and family. Absolutely gorgeous views of the Golden Gate bridge and the homes you probably can never live in. A bit scary at night but if you're with the one you love, it's still a sight to see and you can protect each other from the wind!
author: Dorothy S.

description: A wonderful park with spectacular views and trail. Take the trail from the parking lot until you meet the golf course, and then continue across the road along the edge of the golf course until you meet Clement. Head down Clement/Seal Rock Dr. until you're back at the parking lot. It's a great loop walk (and will take you about an hour if you keep a moderate pace).
author: Jen D.

description: The view of the entrance to SF Bay and of the Golden Gate Bridge from here is truly amazing.  This is one of my stops on my tour of SF I do for all my out of towner friend who "want to see the city."  In addition, with the cleaning up of the bike/walk path from the Sutro district to here, it is a great trail for getting out and doing stuff.
author: Chard M.

description: After reading the requisite tourist literature, you finally mosied to Lands End.  Wise choice young grasshopper.  It's in the tourist books for a reason.  The most obvious one being that, yeah, it's That beautiful.  Lands End is another place of Postcard Lore.  Friends of people who visit San Francisco and make the trip to Lands End are sent postcards of the GG Bridge with the oft used cliche ending "Wish you were here". Lands End is a good excuse to use up a cough cough Sick day.  The views are beautiful, the air is fresh, and you feel all choked up inside about choosing to live in the San Francisco Bay Area.
author: brenda b.

description: Yes, yes. This is the perfect hiking area. A little something for everyone (even if you're pushing a stroller). - 1 star for the time I got nasty, icky poison oak on my elbow . But  + 1 star for the blessed fact that I've never seen an ugly, hairy dude jacking off on the the trails. And that is almost as beautiful as the views.
author: Melinda B.

description: This place is awesome!  You forget that you live in a city when you go to Lands End.  My little beagle moe loves it too!! We just moved here about 6 months ago from NYC and its such a great change because of outdoor places like this.  My boyfriend has been discovering new trails and beach access everytime he goes....but he's more daring and adventurous than I am.  Like when he "thinks" its a trail and its really not, but he makes it one anyway.
author: Maria B.

description: Great hike, quiet, spectacular views, and can be very romantic when you're with the right person. :)
author: Gregg G.

description: I miss Land's End so much.  I use to go all the time.  It's a great place to run, take walks, take visitors.  It's absolutely gorgeous, and it can't help but remind you of why we live in San Francisco.  I would go every week if I could (don't drive anymore and, alas, it'd take quite awhile to get there via Muni for me).
author: Kerry L.

description: My favorite place to hike in the city! The trail is all along the bay. SO BEAUTY. If you want to get away from the city but can't leave it, this spot is just right for you.
author: Shawn P.

description: Where you can climb under a bridge, climb on top of a toll plaza, wander up and down wooden stairways on the brink of the world...
author: Anna B.

description: Beautiful IF you ever get a nice SF day. Born and raised in SF so I know how hard those days are to find. Used to seem like a good place to bring the gfs but after Connie's mention, I think not! If you follow the trail (taken you don't take the wrong turns or go off trail), it'll lead you to the Cliff House. Used to ride my bike on these trails all the time, LOVE IT.
author: Leo T.

description: i love this place !! great views fun place to get lost and get some great scenic pics ! cant wait to go back !!
author: vanessa g.

description: This is a great trail to take a friend, lover or family member for a hike & good conversation. Amazing views of the Bay, not too strenuous, open & safe.
author: Paul H.

description: I can walk to Land's End from my apartment in about 15 minutes, which is great because this is an amazing park that offers fantastic views of the Ocean and the Golden Gate Bridge. Great for walking alone or with someone special, this park offers a more varied terrain than Golden Gate Park. Don't miss this park.
author: Lance J.

description: Wow...Wow...Wow, did I say Wow?  I'm fortunate enough to live right by Lands End so I get to frequent the area.  There is a lot to see and do here and it's really nice how the landscape changes as the sun moves around (or the fog).  It's amazing how many people live in SF and don't even know this place exists.  Actually, maybe that's a good thing!  They are now in the beginnings of "improving" the area which will mean bigger parking lots, "nicer" trails (i.e. geared for idiots), benches, tree clearing, habitat restoration etc.  Hopefully they won't change it too much.
author: Tony B.

description: Wow, Land's End really is the best part of San Francisco, in my opinion. But then again, I'm a high school senior, what would I know? I decided to skip school to take a day off from all the schoolwork and thought visiting this unknown gem would calm my nerves. I walked from Van ness and Bay to Geary and Van Ness and then went straight through. It was a long walk, but I enjoyed the feeling of not having to think. I got there, and wow. EMPTY. But that's okay, because I hate tourists, and most people. The views are so jaw-dropping. The trails are safe for you to walk through, and there are some hidden trails worth exploring. Be wary of long flights of trails, definitely not your Pt. Reyes Lighthouse extremity, but pretty darn close if you hiked all the steps at Land's End. Truly a great spot to relax, take some time to visit!
author: andy y.

description: I saw more than one girl "hiking" this mud-filled trail in heels, which proves that even the most completely idiotic human beings in the city are able to enjoy this beautiful park. Non-native species have invaded the cliffs at Land's Edge to form the perfect vegetative picture frame for the best views of the Bay's entrance and Golden Gate Bridge that you're likely to see. This would be a great place to exercise, except I'm sure that the vistas and the crazy variety of flowers makes it hard to walk the trail briskly, let alone do jogging. In fact, I'm pretty certain that the views are so great here that it isn't even -- as some reviewers have suggested -- a good make out spot. In fact, I tried, but my girlfriend kept zoning out and saying stuff like, "Look at those nice flowers," and "Hey, that dragonfly is carrying away that couple's infant." Of course, it could have been the fish, milk, and pickles that I'd eaten only moments before.
author: Ben P.

description: when i was here last time, it was really windy and the sand was blowing into our skin - it was like tiny pinpricks one every exposed body part. incredible pain. made the trip down quite an adventure.
author: Lijia X.
